rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment describes the cause of spread factually without using high-potency language.
The segment uses plain verbs ('is blamed', 'can contaminate') and describes cause, not impact scale.
The segment does not contain any questions.
This segment explains the cause of spread but contains no explicit calming language or cues.
The segment does not contain a minimiser token ('only', 'just', etc.) combined with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes the cause of spread, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes the cause of disease spread, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
The segment describes a mechanism of disease spread but does not speculate about future relief or improvement.
Segment contains no direct quotes or attributed statements from a source.
Factual description of disease spread mechanism using neutral language. No explicit framing cues present.
